column1: Most uric acid dissolves in blood and travels to the kidneys.
A high level of uric acid in the blood is called hyperuricemia.
This test checks to see how much uric acid you have in your blood.
Most of the time blood is drawn from a vein located on the inside of the elbow or the back of the hand.
Your provider may also tell you to stop taking any drugs that may affect the test results.
This test is done to see if you have high levels of uric acid in your blood.
High levels of uric acid can sometimes cause gout or kidney disease.
Rapid weight loss, which may occur with such treatments, can increase the amount of uric acid in your blood.
